description: A permissive license allowing almost unrestricted use, modification, and distribution, with attribution to the original author.
A copyleft license requiring any modified versions to also be open-source and distributed under the same GPL terms.
A permissive license allowing use, modification, and distribution, with patent rights granted and explicit notices required for attribution.
A permissive license similar to MIT but includes a clause preventing the use of the names of the original project contributors for endorsement.
A simpler version of the BSD 3-Clause, omitting the non-endorsement clause, allowing for permissive use, modification, and redistribution.
A weak copyleft license requiring modified source files to be made open, but allowing linking with proprietary code.
A more permissive version of the GPL, allowing linking with proprietary software while still enforcing open-source for the LGPL-covered components.
A weak copyleft license, similar to MPL, allowing usage with proprietary code but requiring open-source distribution of changes made to the original code.
A license that allows free use, sharing, and adaptation of content, as long as proper credit is given to the original creator.
A public domain dedication, allowing users to do anything with the software without any restrictions or requirements for attribution.
